rpc.model.util
Class Model

java.lang.Object
  rpc.model.util.Model

public class Model
extends java.lang.Object

Model object holds the set of known dependencies. Undirected dependencies are stored as dependencies in each direction for a pair of vertices.

Constructor Summary
Model()
          Initialize a model with an empty set of dependencies.

Set the total number of possible dependencies (i.e., the total number of unique units to test).

public void addDependence(VertexPair vp,
                          Unit u)
Adds a known dependency to the model. Constructs the Dependency object.

Parameters:
vp - the pair of vertices for which the dependency holds.
u - the unit that supports the dependency.

addDependence

public void addDependence(VertexPair vp,
                          Dependency dep)
Adds a known dependency to the model.

Parameters:
vp - the pair of vertices for which the dependency holds.
dep - the Dependency object to add.

addTrivialDependence

public void addTrivialDependence(VertexPair vp)
Adds a known trivial dependency to the model. The dependency will have a null underlying unit.

Parameters:
vp - the pair of vertices for which the trivial dependency holds.

removeDependence

public void removeDependence(VertexPair vp,
                             Unit u)
Removes a dependency from the model.

Parameters:
vp - the pair of vertices for which the dependency is to be removed.
u - the unit that supports the dependency to remove.

removeDependence

public void removeDependence(VertexPair vp)
Removes all dependencies from the model for a given pair of vertices.

Parameters:
vp - the pair of vertices for which the dependencies are to be removed.

getAllDependencies

public java.util.Map<VertexPair,java.util.Set<Dependency>> getAllDependencies()
Retrieve all the dependencies that the model holds.

Returns:
a map from each pair of vertices to the set of Dependency objects that hold for each.

getDependencies

public java.util.Set<Dependency> getDependencies(VertexPair vp)
Get all the dependencies that hold for a given pair of vertices.

Parameters:
vp - the given pair of vertices.
Returns:
the set of Dependency objects that hold for the pair of vertices.

hasNonTrivialDependence

public boolean hasNonTrivialDependence(VertexPair vp)
Checks whether or not the given vertex pair has a non-trivial dependency

Parameters:
vp - the vertex pair in question.
Returns:
true if the vertex pair has a Dependency with a non-null unit that supports it; false otherwise.

Get the set of neighbors of a given vertex, ignoring the direction of dependencies.

Parameters:

Returns:
the set of neighboring vertices.

Get the set of parents of a given vertex (i.e., the vertices for which this vertex is a child).

Parameters:
v - the child vertex.
Returns:
the set of parent vertices.

hasDependence

public boolean hasDependence(VertexPair vp)
Checks whether or not there exists a dependency for the given pair of vertices.

Parameters:
vp - the vertex pair in question.
Returns:
true if there is a dependency from the first vertex to the second vertex (regardless if there is a dependency in the opposite direction); false otherwise.

hasEdge

public boolean hasEdge(VertexPair vp)
Checks whether or not there exists a dependency between the given pair of vertices, ignoring direction.

Parameters:
vp - the vertex pair in question.
Returns:
true if there is either a dependency from the first vertex to the second or vice versa; false otherwise.

hasDirectedEdge

public boolean hasDirectedEdge(VertexPair vp)
Checks whether or not there is a directed edge between the given pair of vertices, regardless of direction.

Parameters:
vp - the vertex pair in question.
Returns:
true if there is either a dependency from the first vertex to the second or vice versa, but not in both directions; false otherwise.

checkDependence

public boolean checkDependence(VertexPair vp,
                               Dependency dep)
Checks whether or not the model has the specified dependency for the given vertex pair.

Parameters:
vp - the pair of vertices.
dep - the dependency.
Returns:
true if the pair of vertices has the specified dependency between them; false otherwise.

checkDirectedDependence

public boolean checkDirectedDependence(VertexPair vp,
                                       Dependency dep)
Checks whether or not the model has the specified dependency for the given vertex pair and that the reverse dependency does not exist in the model.

Parameters:
vp - the pair of vertices.
dep - the dependency.
Returns:
true if the pair of vertices has the specified dependency between them and the reverse does not exist in the model; false otherwise.

checkReverseDependence

public boolean checkReverseDependence(VertexPair vp,
                                      Dependency dep)
Checks whether or not the model stores the reverse of the specified dependency for the reverse of the given pair of vertices.

Parameters:
vp - the pair of vertices.
dep - the dependency.
Returns:
true if the reverse of the given pair of vertices has the reverse of the specified dependency between them in the model; false otherwise.

commonExistsEffect

public boolean commonExistsEffect(Vertex v1,
                                  Vertex v2)
Checks whether or not the model currently has an existence (or structural) variable as a potential common effect of two given vertices. The potential dependencies must be non-trivial.

Parameters:
v1 - vertex 1.
v2 - veretex 2.
Returns:
true if the two vertices have the potential for common effect of an existence variable; false otherwise.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation, which is just a dump of the map containing all dependencies for each pair of vertices.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
the string representation.

getDotFile

public void getDotFile(java.lang.String filename,
                       boolean withEdgeLabels)
Gets the dot file that can be used to visualize all dependency information in the model.

Parameters:
filename - the name of the file to write out the dot.
withEdgeLabels - flag denoting whether or not to also write out annotations about the path information for each dependency.
